definitions.definition: a small amount of something that shows what the rest of it is like

examples.text: Astronauts have brought back specimens of rock from the moon.
Can you give me a specimen of your handwriting?

definitions.definition: a single example of something, especially an animal or a plant

examples.text: The aquarium has some interesting specimens of unusual tropical fish.
Redwood trees can live for a long time; one specimen is 4 000 years old.
They were fine specimens of British youth!
This is a fine specimen of a walnut tree.

definitions.definition: a small quantity of blood, urine, etc. that is taken from somebody and tested by a doctor

examples.text: The motorist may be required to give a urine specimen.

wordOrigin: early 17th cent. (in the sense ‘pattern, model’): from Latin, from specere ‘to look’.
